article.headline: CS Northridge 76, UC Riverside 62
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Mike Efevberha scored all 16 of his points in the second half to lead Cal State Northridge past UC Riverside 76-62 Monday night. Efevberha, whose 22.2-point average entering the game ranked him 15th nationally, scored five points as part of the game's decisive 9-2 second-half run that turned a 28-26 halftime lead into a 37-27 lead with 18:01 to play. Northridge, (6-6, 1-1 Big West Conference) which ended a three-game losing streak, led by at least eight points the rest of the way and as many as 17. Rob Haynes, Calvin Chitwood, and reserve Terrell Jones each scored 12 points for the Matadors. It was a career high for Haynes. Riverside (2-12, 2-2) had upset Pacific Saturday night behind Rickey Porter' s career-best 40 points, but the Highlanders missed their first eight field-goal attempts and shot just 33 percent (18-for-54) from the field Monday night. Porter went scoreless in the first half and finished with just two points. Dedrick Bates led the Highlanders with 12 points, and Christian Soto and Larry Cunningham scored 11 apiece.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
